abstract: A group called Positive Coaching Alliance is training thousands of coaches and parents to change to culture of youth sports for the better.
snippet: A group called Positive Coaching Alliance is training thousands of coaches and parents to change to culture of youth sports for the better.
lead_paragraph: Imagine you're coaching a big soccer game, against an undefeated team that has beaten your team in all your previous matches. Your 11-year-olds are playing well and are ahead. Then, in the closing minutes, the official makes a bad call that goes against you and, because of it, you lose. After the game, the parents of your players scream at the official. The kids are disappointed, looking up at you. What do you do?
